trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to host a Ruby on Rails website on Azure using a Linux virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to host a Ruby on Rails website on Azure using a Linux virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial was validated using Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial was validated using Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS.

trans-unit.source: If you use a different Linux distribution, you might need to modify the steps to install Rails.
trans-unit.target: If you use a different Linux distribution, you might need to modify the steps to install Rails.

trans-unit.source: Add an endpoint
trans-unit.target: Add an endpoint

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Azure Management Portal][management-portal] and select your VM.
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Azure Management Portal][management-portal] and select your VM.

trans-unit.source: ![virtual machine list][vmlist]
trans-unit.target: ![virtual machine list][vmlist]

trans-unit.source: Select **ENDPOINTS** at the top of the page, and then click **+ ADD ENDPOINT** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select **ENDPOINTS** at the top of the page, and then click **+ ADD ENDPOINT** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![endpoints page][endpoints]
trans-unit.target: ![endpoints page][endpoints]

trans-unit.source: In the **ADD ENDPOINT** dialog, select "Add a standalone endpoint" and click the **Next** arrow.
trans-unit.target: In the **ADD ENDPOINT** dialog, select "Add a standalone endpoint" and click the **Next** arrow.

trans-unit.source: ![new endpoint dialog][new-endpoint1]
trans-unit.target: ![new endpoint dialog][new-endpoint1]

trans-unit.source: In the next dialog page, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the next dialog page, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: **NAME**: HTTP
trans-unit.target: **NAME**: HTTP

trans-unit.source: **PROTOCOL**: TCP
trans-unit.target: **PROTOCOL**: TCP

trans-unit.source: **PUBLIC PORT**: 80
trans-unit.target: **PUBLIC PORT**: 80

trans-unit.source: **PRIVATE PORT**: 3000
trans-unit.target: **PRIVATE PORT**: 3000

trans-unit.source: This will create a public port of 80 that will route traffic to the private port of 3000, where the Rails server is listening.
trans-unit.target: This will create a public port of 80 that will route traffic to the private port of 3000, where the Rails server is listening.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to save the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to save the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: A message should appear that states **UPDATE IN PROGRESS**.
trans-unit.target: A message should appear that states **UPDATE IN PROGRESS**.

trans-unit.source: Once this message disappears, the endpoint is active.
trans-unit.target: Once this message disappears, the endpoint is active.
